title: San Francisco Will Remember Bob Weir With Special â€˜Homecomingâ€™ Event
summary: â€œHomecoming: Celebrating the life of Bobby Weirâ€ will move through SF this Saturday, Jan. 17.
body: The late Grateful Dead legend Bob Weir will be remembered in his hometown, San Francisco, this weekend with a special commemoration of his life and career. â€œHomecoming: Celebrating the life of Bobby Weir,â€ a free public gathering, will move through SF this Saturday, Jan. 17 at Civic Center Plaza, starting at 3:45pm ET. “Homecoming” will remember Weir, whose â€œmusic, spirit and humanity shaped generation,â€ reads a statement from organizers. â€œTogether, we will pay tribute in the community and collective heartbeat that he created.â€ Reps say this weekend’s salute is not a concert and there will be no live performances, but will instead center on â€œgratitude, remembrance, and togetherness,â€ along with special tributes to honor the late artist. A procession will travel three blocks down Market Street between 7th and 9th Streets at approximately 3:30pm ET. Weir, the guitarist and jam-band pioneer who co-founded the Grateful Dead and continued their legacy in the 21st century with Furthur, Dead & Company and more, died last week due to underlying lung issues after fighting cancer. He was 78. And he was one of San Francisco’s most treasured sons. In a career spannâ€¦

title: Addison Rae, Lowlands, ExitÂ Win Big at 2025 European FestivalÂ Awards
summary: Festivals from over 30 countries participated in the awards, now in its 15th year, with 300,000 votes cast by the public.
body: Rising U.S. pop star Addison Rae was the hottest newcomer, Switzerlandâ€™s PalÃ©o Festival Nyon was the best major festival, Hollandâ€™s Lowlands had the greatest lineup, and Serbiaâ€™s Exit Festival scooped promoter of the year at the European Festival Awards 2025, recognizing the best fests on the Continent. Announced this week, festivals from over 30 countries participated in the awards, now in its 15 th year, with 300,000 votes cast by the public. All told, 104 nominees were shortlisted in 13 distinct categories, not counting the lifetime achievement award, won by Austriaâ€™s Ewald Tatar. The awards ceremony took place on the opening night of the four-day annual ESNS music showcase festival and conference, presented Jan. 14-17 in Groningen, The Netherlands. Other winners on the night include dHungaryâ€™s Sziget Festival (The Take a Stand Award), Czech Republicâ€™s Rock for People (The Event Safety Award) and ITBâ€™s Steve Zapp won for agent of the year. All the winners of the European Festival Awards 2025: The Take a Stand Award (Presented by Take A Stand) — Sziget Festival (Hungary) Line-Up of the Year (Presented by IQ Magazine) Lowlands (The Netherlands) The Event Safety Award (Preseâ€¦

title: Clouds Swimming over Lago Argentino
summary: A collection of fish-shaped clouds hovered above the glacial lake in Patagonia in December 2025.
body: Earth Observatory Science Earth Observatory Clouds Swimming over Lagoâ€¦ Earth Earth Observatory Image of the Day EO Explorer Topics All Topics Atmosphere Land Heat & Radiation Life on Earth Human Dimensions Natural Events Oceans Remote Sensing Technology Snow & Ice Water More Content Collections Global Maps World of Change Articles Notes from the Field Blog Earth Matters Blog Blue Marble: Next Generation EO Kids Mission: Biomes About About Us Subscribe ğŸ›œ RSS Contact Us Search December 27, 2025 When an astronaut aboard the International Space Station snapped this photograph of Lago Argentino in Patagonia on December 27, 2025, a school of fish-shaped clouds lingered over the glacial lakeâ€™s teal waters. Determining the cloudsâ€™ type and origin from the photograph alone is challenging, but several NASA scientists and university researchers offered a theory after reviewing the image. â€œThe lens shape reminds me of lenticular clouds , which usually form near or over mountains,â€ said Maria Hakuba, a research scientist in the aerosols and clouds group at NASAâ€™s Jet Propulsion Laboratory. â€œThe edges of the cloud also look quite smooth rather than â€˜fuzzy,â€™ which suggests theyâ€™re iceâ€¦

title: MerlinÂ Welcomes Five New BoardÂ Members
summary: Merlinâ€™s board for 2026-27 features some fresh faces, and a return of the executive who established the organization.
body: LONDON, U.K. — Merlinâ€™s board for 2026-27 features some fresh faces, and a return of the executive who established the organization. The independentsâ€™ digital rights agency this week announced five new members to its board, the first formed since the appointment of Charlie Lexton as chief executive officer, succeeding Jeremy Sirota. Newly elected to the board are Bugwu Aneto-Okeke, Measurable Accurate Digital Solutions (Nigeria); Charles Caldas, Exceleration (Portugal); Manami Ogawa, STARBASE (Japan); Rachel Buswell, Domino (U.K.); and Sascha Lazimbat, Zebralution (Germany). Itâ€™s a welcome return to the Merlin fold for Caldas, the Australian-born and raised executive who served as founding CEO of the association from 2007 , until he stepped down from the role in December 2019. In addition to the elected members, Merlin appoints Dan Waite, Better Noise (U.K.) and VerÃ³nica Rojas, Casete (Mexico) as board observers. Re-elected to the Merlin board and continuing their service are Carlos Mills, Mills Records (Brazil); Chris Maund, Mushroom (Australia); Darius Van Arman, Secretly Group (U.S.); Golda Bitterli, Revelator (Israel); Justin West, Secret City Records (Canada); Louiâ€¦

title: Mike Chapman to Receive Lifetime Achievement Honor at Australiaâ€™s MPEGÂ Awards
summary: The annual MPEG Awards was established by Music Producer and Engineersâ€™ Guild of Australia (MPEG) to shine a light on excellence across music production, engineering and studio work.
body: Mike Chapman, the legendary songwriter and producer behind hits for Blondie, Suzy Quatro, Pat Benatar, Tina Turner, Toni Basil, and many others, will be saluted at the 2026 MPEG Awards. The Nambour, Queensland-raised music man will receive the 2026 MPEG Lifetime Achievement Award next month during a ceremony in Sydney, recognition as one of Australiaâ€™s most influential global music figures. After relocating to the U.K. in the 1970s, Chapman joined forces with Nicky Chinn and set about changing the face of pop music with hits for Suzi Quatro, Smokie, Mud and Sweet. A move to the United States proved to be a shrewd one, as Chapman went on to produce Blondieâ€™s classic  Parallel Lines  (from 1978), housing the global smash â€œHeart of Glass.â€ Chapman kept the hits coming by producing Get The Knack (1979), home to the Knackâ€™s blistering â€œMy Sharona,â€ and through the 1980s he co-wrote a long list of smashes with Holly Knight, including â€œLove Is a Battlefieldâ€ (Pat Benatar), â€œBetter Be Good to Meâ€ and â€œThe Bestâ€ (Tina Turner). Across his decorated, five-decade career, Chapman has amassed a vast tab of production credits, from Baby Animals to Pat Benatar, Rod Stewart, Bow Wow Wow,â€¦

title: Calvin Harris Wins $13.5 Million in First Bout of Legal Battle With Ex-BusinessÂ Manager
summary: An arbitrator has ordered Thomas St. John to repay the Scottish DJ for a real estate loan, plus interest.
body: Calvin Harris has secured a $13.5 million judgment in the first phase of a bitter legal feud with his longtime business manager Thomas St. John , whom the EDM star has accused of abusing their financial relationship to fund a real estate â€œboondoggle.â€ Harris (real name Adam Wiles) initiated arbitration proceedings this summer, alleging that in 2023, St. John fraudulently funneled $22 million from the Scottish DJâ€™s accounts towards a Hollywood recording studio and office space development called CMNTY Culture Campus, which never broke ground and has since undergone foreclosure. St. John denies Harrisâ€™ claims as â€œcategorically falseâ€ and maintains that the artist was a willing investor. Related Inside the Hollywood Real Estate ‘Boondoggle’ at the Center of Calvin Harrisâ€™ Fraud Claims Harris funded CMNTY Culture in two tranches: a $10 million loan and a $12 million equity investment. Retired federal judge Michael R. Wilner, whoâ€™s refereeing the dispute in confidential arbitration, ruled in December that St. John undisputedly failed to repay the loan by its due date.   â€œHollywood LLC and TSJ are each jointly and severally liable to claimants for the principal sumâ€¦

title: A$AP Rocky Reveals â€˜Donâ€™t Be Dumbâ€™ Track List Ahead of Albumâ€™sÂ Arrival
summary: Rocky season is here.
body: The wait for A$AP Rocky’s DON’T BE DUMB album is finally over, as the rapper revealed the project’s tracklist on Wednesday (Jan. 14). With Rocky’s fourth LP set to arrive on Friday (Jan. 16), the Mob frontman posted the track list to the album, which boasts 15 tracks in total and one listed skit. Previously released singles “Helicopter” and “Punk Rocky” are also on the album. Related A$AP Rocky Says Denies New ‘Helicopter$’ Video Is AI, Calls Visual ‘JUST GENERATIONAL’ Watch A$AP Rocky Get Arrested & Beat the Odds in Chaotic ‘Punk Rocky’ Video Starring Winona Ryder Tim McGraw Tapped For NHL Stadium Series Show Unfortunately, there aren’t any featured artists listed, so the surprises will wait for special guests until release day. “DONTBEDUMB OFFICIAL TRACKLIST!!! EXCLUSIVE @ONEQUINCE SHIRTHEADS VINYL AVAILABLE NOW,” Rocky wrote when revealing the track list with various posters and vinyl editions. Per a press release, the Harlem native has already sold over 130,000 units ahead of the project landing on DSPs. Pusha T, Three 6 Mafia and Hit-Boy showed Rocky love in his commâ€¦

title: J. Cole Tells Life Story in Reverse in New Song & Video â€˜Disc 2 TrackÂ 2â€™
summary: Cole drops a new single & music video after announcing the release date for The Fall-Off.
body: J. Cole is back. The North Carolina rapper followed up announcing the the long-awaited release date for his upcoming album The Fall-Off with what is looking like the project’s lead single. And while he didn’t provide a title for the song, he did hint at The Fall-Off being a double disc by naming the track “Disc 2 Track 2,” so it’s safe to assume the tracklist will be revealed in due time. Related J. Cole Announces New Album ‘The Fall-Off’ & Its Release Date: Watch the Trailer Tim McGraw Tapped For NHL Stadium Series Show Spotify Spotlights Artists, Songwriters to Watch In 2026 The video, directed by Ryan Doubiago, starts off with a disclaimer before taking us through an Inception -like labyrinth of Cole’s life in reverse as the rapper narrates his story in the same fashion almost reminiscent of Nas ‘ “ Rewind .” The disclaimer reads: “For the past 10 years, this album has been hand crafted with one intention: a personal challenge to myself to create my best work. To do on my last what I was unable to do on my first. I had no way of knowing how much time, focus and energy it would eventually take to acâ€¦

title: Yeison JimÃ©nez Remembered by Paola Jara, Jessi Uribe & More Than 14,000 Fans at Movistar Arena inÂ BogotÃ¡
summary: The Colombian singer died in a plane crash Jan. 10 at age 34.
body: Still shaken by the sudden loss of Yeison JimÃ©nez , one of the biggest stars in Colombian “mÃºsica popular,” thousands of fans (14,000, as announced onstage) gathered at the Movistar Arena in BogotÃ¡ on Wednesday (Jan. 14) to pay tribute to the artist. JimÃ©nez, known for hits like â€œAventureroâ€ and â€œDestino Finalâ€ with Luis Alfonso, died Saturday in a plane crash in Paipa (BoyacÃ¡) after the aircraft failed to gain enough altitude and crashed. Five other people, including Jefferson Osorio, the artist’s manager; Oscar MarÃ­n, his personal assistant; and Weismann Mora, a photographer, also lost their lives. Related Yeison JimÃ©nez, Colombian Popular Music Star, Dies in Plane Crash at 34 Remembering Yeison Jimenez: 5 Best Anthems From the Colombian MÃºsica Popular Star Tim McGraw Tapped For NHL Stadium Series Show For the artist’s farewell, entrance to the Movistar Arena was divided into two sessions: the first from noon to 4 p.m. (local time) and the second from 6 to 10 p.m. In both time slots, entry was allowed until the venue reached full capacity. Admission was free, and organizers emphasized the importance of not bringing candles, food or drinks. Fans â€¦

title: Joey Valence & Brae Announce 2026 Australia and New Zealand TourÂ Dates
summary: The tour will mark the duoâ€™s second visit to the region following their debut Australia and New Zealand run in 2025.
body: Joey Valence & Brae are returning to Australia and New Zealand in April 2026, announcing a run of headline shows in support of their latest album, HYPERYOUTH . The tour will mark the duoâ€™s second visit to the region following their debut Australia and New Zealand run in 2025, which included sold-out headline shows in Sydney and Melbourne and an appearance at Australia’s Laneway Festival . The newly announced dates represent their largest venues in the region to date. The HYPERYOUTH World Tour will kick off on April 9 in Auckland before heading to Melbourne, Brisbane, Sydney and Perth. Presale tickets go on sale Tuesday, Jan. 20 at 10 a.m. local time, with general on-sale beginning Wednesday, Jan. 21 at 10 a.m. local time. The tour arrives in support of the duoâ€™s latest album, HYPERYOUTH , which was released late last year. The project was produced, mixed and mastered entirely by Joey Valence and represents the pairâ€™s most fully realized statement to date, expanding on the maximalist sound that first drew attention online while sharpening their focus as writers and performers. The album features guest appearances from JPEGMAFIA, Rebecca Black and TiaCorine. Joey Valence &â€¦

title: Coverage, Briefing Set for NASAâ€™s Artemis II Moon Rocket Roll to Pad
summary: NASAâ€™s integrated SLS (Space Launch System) rocket and Orion spacecraft for the Artemis II mission is inching closer to launch â€“ literally. The agency is targeting no earlier than 7 a.m. EST, Saturday, Jan. 17, to begin the multi-hour trek from the Vehicle Assembly Building to Launch Pad 39B at NASâ€¦
body: NASAâ€™s SLS (Space Launch System) rocket is seen inside High Bay 3 of the Vehicle Assembly Building as teams await the arrival of Artemis II crewmembers to board their Orion spacecraft on top of the rocket as part of the Artemis II countdown demonstration test, Saturday, Dec. 20, 2025, at NASAâ€™s Kennedy Space Center in Florida. Credit: NASA/Joel Kowsky NASAâ€™s integrated SLS (Space Launch System) rocket and Orion spacecraft for the Artemis II mission is inching closer to launch â€“ literally. The agency is targeting no earlier than 7 a.m. EST, Saturday, Jan. 17, to begin the multi-hour trek from the Vehicle Assembly Building to Launch Pad 39B at NASAâ€™s Kennedy Space Center in Florida. A pre rollout mission news conference, live feed of rollout, and a media gaggle will stream on NASAâ€™s YouTube channel. Individual streams for each of these events will be available from that page. Learn how to stream NASA content through a variety of online platforms, including social media. The time of rollout is subject to change if additional time is needed for technical preparations or weather. All times are Eastern. Events are as follows: Friday, Jan. 16: 12 p.m.: Artemis II Rollout, Mission Overvieâ€¦

title: New Yorkâ€“Newarkâ€“Jersey City Metropolitan Area
summary: The New Yorkâ€“Newarkâ€“Jersey City Metropolitan Statistical Area, which spans 23 counties across New York, New Jersey, and Connecticut and has a population of about 19.9 million, is pictured at approximately 3:29 a.m. local time Dec. 20, 2025, from the International Space Station as it orbited 262 milâ€¦
body: NASA The New Yorkâ€“Newarkâ€“Jersey City Metropolitan Statistical Area, which spans 23 counties across New York, New Jersey, and Connecticut and has a population of about 19.9 million, is pictured at approximately 3:29 a.m. local time Dec. 20, 2025, from the International Space Station as it orbited 262 miles above the Atlantic coast. Crew members aboard the orbital lab have produced hundreds of thousands of images of the land, oceans, and atmosphere of Earth, and even of the Moon through Crew Earth Observations . Their photographs of Earth record how the planet changes over time due to human activity and natural events. This allows scientists to monitor disasters and direct response on the ground and study a number of phenomena, from the movement of glaciers to urban wildlife. Image credit: NASA

title: NASA Releases Global Temperature Data
summary: Lee este comunicado de prensa en espaÃ±ol aquÃ­. Earthâ€™s global surface temperature in 2025 was slightly warmer than 2023 â€“ but within the margin of error the two years are effectively tied according to an analysis by NASA scientists. Since record-keeping began in 1880, the hottest year on record remâ€¦
body: Credit: NASA Lee este comunicado de prensa en espaÃ±ol  aquÃ­. Earthâ€™s global surface temperature in 2025 was slightly warmer than 2023 â€“ but within the margin of error the two years are effectively tied according to an analysis by NASA scientists. Since record-keeping began in 1880, the hottest year on record remains 2024.  Global temperatures in 2025 were cooler than 2024, with average temperatures of 2.14 degrees Fahrenheit (1.19 degrees Celsius) above the 1951 to 1980 average. The analysis from NASAâ€™s Goddard Institute for Space Studies includes air temperature data acquired by more than 25,000 meteorological stations around the world, from ship- and buoy-based instruments measuring sea surface temperature, and Antarctic research stations. The data are analyzed using methods that account for the changing distribution of temperature stations and for urban heating effects that could skew the calculations. Additionally, independent analyses by the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration, Berkeley Earth, the Hadley Centre (part of the United Kingdomâ€™s weather forecasting Met Office), and Copernicus Climate Services in Europe have concluded the global surface temperâ€¦

body: Four SpaceX Crew-11 members gather together for a crew portrait wearing their Dragon pressure suits during a suit verification check inside the International Space Station’s Kibo laboratory module. Clockwise from bottom left are, NASA astronaut Mike Fincke, Roscosmos cosmonaut Oleg Platonov, NASA astronaut Zena Cardman, and JAXA (Japan Aerospace Exploration Agency) astronaut Kimiya Yui. Credit: NASA Editor’s note: This advisory was updated on Wednesday, Jan. 14 to update the undocking time and coverage Lee este comunicado de prensa en espaÃ±ol  aquÃ­. NASA and SpaceX are targeting no earlier than 5:20 p.m. EST, Wednesday, Jan. 14, for the undocking of the agencyâ€™s SpaceX Crew-11 mission from the International Space Station, pending weather conditions. On Jan. 8, NASA announced its decision to return the agencyâ€™s SpaceX Crew-11 mission to Earth from the space station earlier than originally planned as teams monitor a medical concern with a crew member currently living and working aboard the orbital laboratory, who is stable . Due to medical privacy, it is not appropriate for NASA to share more details about the crew member. NASA astronauts Zena Cardman and Mike Finckâ€¦

title: Man City beat Everton at home to strengthen grip on WSL title

title: The man behind the headlines - Salah, by Klopp, Diaz and more
summary: BBC Sport explores Mohamed Salah's personality with help from the people who know him best.

title: Inside McLaren's season - the rules, values, incidents & relationships
summary: Intra-team title battles turn toxic far more often than not. Andrew Benson analyses how McLaren have maintained relative harmony between Lando Norris and Oscar Piastri.

title: England's AI World Cup masterplan - from perfecting penalties to powering players
summary: BBC Sport hears from inside the England setup about how artificial intelligence is powering plans for next summer's World Cup.

title: 'Raise hell' - the fastest bowler you might not have heard of
summary: The story of Duncan Spencer, the "frighteningly fast" bowler who could have played for England or Australia.
